content:
It is understandable to have concerns about the long-term effects of consuming genetically modified foods. However, it's important to note that there is currently no scientific evidence to suggest that genetically modified foods pose a long-term risk to human health. 

That being said, it is always wise to make informed decisions about food choices, and it is important to be aware of the potential risks and benefits of any food product. Consulting with registered dieticians or other health professionals can provide valuable insight into food choices and any associated health risks. 

Ultimately, the choice of whether to consume genetically modified foods is a personal decision based on one's individual beliefs and values.
